definitions.definition: ( intransitive ) To move by hopping on alternate feet .
examples: She will skip from one end of the sidewalk to the other.

definitions.definition: ( intransitive ) To skim , ricochet or bounce over a surface .
examples: The rock will skip across the pond.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To throw (something), making it skim, ricochet, or bounce over a surface.
examples: I bet I can skip this rock to the other side of the pond.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To disregard , miss or omit part of a continuation (some item or stage ).
examples: My heart will skip a beat.
He skipped the second question and moved on.
I will read most of the book, but skip the first chapter because the video covered it.

definitions.definition: ( transitive , informal ) Not to attend (some event, especially a class or a meeting).
examples: Yeah, I really should go to the quarterly meeting but I think I'm going to skip it.

definitions.definition: ( transitive , informal ) To leave , especially in a sudden and covert manner.
examples: a customer who skipped town without paying her hotel bill
The girls were skipping in the playground.

definitions.definition: To cause the stylus to jump back to the previous loop of the record's groove , continously repeating that part of the sound, as a result of excessive scratching or wear. ( of a phonograph record )
( knitting , crochet ) To pass by a stitch as if it were not there, continuing with the next stitch.
( printing ) To have insufficient ink transfer.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To move by hopping on alternate feet .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To skim , ricochet or bounce over a surface .
( transitive ) To throw (something), making it skim, ricochet, or bounce over a surface.
( transitive ) To disregard , miss or omit part of a continuation (some item or stage ).
( transitive , informal ) Not to attend (some event, especially a class or a meeting).
( transitive , informal ) To leave , especially in a sudden and covert manner.
To cause the stylus to jump back to the previous loop of the record's groove , continously repeating that part of the sound, as a result of excessive scratching or wear. ( of a phonograph record )
( knitting , crochet ) To pass by a stitch as if it were not there, continuing with the next stitch.
( printing ) To have insufficient ink transfer.

definitions.definition: To place an item in a skip (etymology 2, sense 1).

main_definition: ( transitive ) To place an item in a skip (etymology 2, sense 1).
